item.description: Either a W1 or W2 method of [[Dispute Resolution]] can be opted for within an [[NEC3]] [[contract]]. According to NEC Contract Website :

item.title: 1. Understanding and Practical Application of Engineering
item.description: 1. Understanding and Practical Application of Engineering This Attribute is subdivided into 8 parts if you are aiming for Chartered Engineer level.

item.title: 2. Management and Leadership
item.description: 2. Management and Leadership What does this mean exactly? If you read the text carefully from the first attribute, you will notice that half of the sub-attributes relate to whether you are driving the industry forward with your engineering research or application.

item.title: 3. Commercial Ability
item.description: 3. Commercial Ability During the 2013 ICE Review sessions, Commercial Ability was the most divided failure point, with 70% of Hong Kong applicants failing on this Attribute alone.

item.title: 4. Health Safety and Welfare
item.description: 4. Health Safety and Welfare Health and Safety is a serious and important topic in the construction industry. It is expected for every person who travels to work on a construction site, is able to safely return home after finishing work each day.

item.title: 5. Sustainable Development
item.description: 5. Sustainable Development While there are now people making whole careers as environmental specialists, your job as a Chartered Civil Engineer will require very intricate involvement with sustainability studies, as described by these sub-parts.

item.title: 6. Interpersonal Skills and Communication
item.description: 6. Interpersonal Skills and Communication You cannot succeed in engineering, or any skilled profession, without strong communication skills. Of all the Attributes you will be reviewed against, this is probably the easiest to fulfil and the one that has strongest transferability should you wish to consider a career change.

item.title: 7. Professional Commitment
item.description: 7. Professional Commitment The last of ICE’s 7 Attributes is Professional Commitment. A) Understand and comply with the ICE Code of Conduct

item.title: Areas MOC
item.description: I have many different interests, from music to hot-air ballooning! This page is a directory of some of the topics which may interest civil engineers, or those who are interested in technology and productivity.

item.title: Calculate bearing capacity of soils
item.description: Calculate bearing capacity of soils Navigation: Homepage, Civil Engineering MOC, Areas MOC

item.title: Civil Engineering MOC
item.description: Civil Engineering “Civil engineers design, create and connect up the world around us. They help make our villages, towns and cities work for the people that live there.

item.title: CJK + Latex Support (测试)
item.description: Chinese, Japanese, Korean Support 几乎在我们意识到之前，我们已经离开了地面。 우리가 그것을 알기도 전에 우리는 땅을 떠났습니다. 私たちがそれを知るほぼ前に、私たちは地面を離れていました。 Latex Block math works with two dollar signs $$.

item.title: Commercial MOC
item.description: Commercial MOC Civil engineering and the decisions made within it are all dictated by the commercial arrangements between the involved parties.

item.title: Communication Task
item.description: Communication Task Taken from The Civil Engineering Exam - the Communication Task Example ICE Communication Task Example Here at The Civil Engineering Exam, we constantly learn from each other and try to make sure our skills stay sharp.

item.title: Compensation Event (CE)
item.description: Compensation Event (CE) A compensation event is a reassessment of cost or the allocated time to complete a task due to events outside the control of the Subcontractor.

item.title: Configuration
item.description: Configuration Quartz is designed to be extremely configurable. You can find the bulk of the configuration scattered throughout the repository depending on how in-depth you’d like to get.

item.title: Contract
item.description: Contract Every contract essentially boils down to three components, and a contract cannot be legally binding without any of them. These are:

item.title: Core Clauses
item.description: Core Clauses [[NEC3]] contracts have a set of nine [[Core Clauses]]. These are the same in every form, and cover the [[Contract]] basics.

item.title: Custom Domain
item.description: Registrar This step is only applicable if you are using a custom domain! If you are using a <YOUR-USERNAME>.github.io domain, you can skip this step.

item.title: Deploying Quartz to the Web
item.description: GitHub Pages Quartz is designed to be effortless to deploy. If you forked and cloned Quartz directly from the repository, everything should already be good to go!

item.title: Design MOC
item.description: Design MOC I started completing civil engineering design work as part of a [[Temporary Works]] design team. I am slowly gathering new methods and ways of solving problems, which I will share here for future reference.

item.title: Editing Content in Quartz
item.description: Editing Quartz runs on top of Hugo so all notes are written in Markdown. Obsidian I recommend using Obsidian as a way to edit and grow your digital garden.

item.title: Ignoring Notes
item.description: Quartz Ignore Edit ignoreFiles in config.toml to include paths you’d like to exclude from being rendered. 1 2 3 4 5 6 .

item.title: Map of Content (MOC)
item.description: Map of Content (MOC) A map of content is a way of viewing a lot of notes related to a particular topic.

item.title: Obsidian
item.description: Obsidian Navigation: Homepage, Civil Engineering MOC, Areas MOC

item.title: Personal Knowledge Management
item.description: Personal Knowledge Management (PKM) A personal knowledge management system is a system by which you enter information and past experience in order to free up mental space.

item.title: Preview Changes
item.description: If you’d like to preview what your Quartz site looks like before deploying it to the internet, here’s exactly how to do that!

item.title: Priced Contract
item.description: Priced Contract Priced contracts are where a lump sum of work is allocated for a project, and money is released under different conditions.

item.title: Professional Review
item.description: Professional Review The [[notes/Professional Review MOC]] is the final stage of becoming a [[Chartered Civil Engineer (CEng)]]. As per the ICE guidance report, the following stages need to be completed prior to sitting the professional review.

item.title: Quartz Philosophy
item.description: “[One] who works with the door open gets all kinds of interruptions, but [they] also occasionally gets clues as to what the world is and what might be important.

item.title: Setup
item.description: Making your own Quartz Setting up Quartz requires a basic understanding of git. If you are unfamiliar, this resource is a great place to start!

item.title: Showcase
item.description: Want to see what Quartz can do? Here are some cool community gardens :) Quartz Documentation (this site!) Jacky Zhao’s Garden AWAGMI Intern Notes Shihyu’s PKM Chloe’s Garden SlRvb’s Site Course notes for Information Technology Advanced Theory Brandon Boswell’s Garden Siyang’s Courtyard If you want to see your own on here, submit a Pull Request adding yourself to this file!

item.title: Site Work MOC
item.description: Site Work The majority of my time within the civil engineering industry has been spent on site. That is, completing setting out activities, managing work gangs, planning and programming tasks and monitoring works.

item.title: Target Cost
item.description: Target Cost The Target Cost contract type differs from the Priced Contracts in that the risk is shared between the contractor and the client, in that a pre-agreed “pain/gain” share is agreed whereby any savings are shared between the client and contractor, as well as any losses as a result from exceeding the agreed price.

item.title: Troubleshooting and FAQ
item.description: Still having trouble? Here are a list of common questions and problems people encounter when installing Quartz. While you’re here, join our Discord :)

item.title: Z Clauses
item.description: Z Clauses Z Clauses are a key part of the contract which can change and alter the way the contract functions.
